Revert calling saveMessages unconditionally

We want `saveMessages` to only be called if an error occurred.
Otherwise all info messages but the most recent are discarded in case of
success.
In particular this causes messages like: "OS Image Build Host type has
been applied." to not be displayed when updating `System Properties`.

Signed-off-by: Pascal Arlt <parlt@suse.com>

Move maintenance window related code to the end of the function

If `Fail` is selected as the reschedule strategy and there is actions
inside of the maintenance windows of selected schedule, changing the
schedule fails and a db rollback occurs.
This rollback also affect querying the `BaseEntitlement` of the system
which causes an internal server error.
Moving the maintenance window related code to the end of the
`processSubmission` call ensures that the rollback occurs after any
other db interactions.

Franky: when the tasko unscheduling doesn't work, then it's kind of fine and we could ignore: in the worst case the action will be executed by tasko, but no action will be found.
Worse thing is the re-scheduling of actions. Maybe we need to have schedule all-or-nothing on taskomatic side.

timeline.bodyText: I'd suggest using camelCase (even though that the other attributes don't use it (which is ugly :) )).
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText: I'd be careful with the lazy fetching here. The org attribute is part of hashCode, equals and toString, meaning that any operation using these (like putting a MaintenanceCalendar into a set, or printing it to the log) can fire a SELECT. I'd stick to the default here (when you don't specify the fetch strategy on @ManyToOne, then "eager" strategy is used). Being eager here shouldn't really have big performance impact. It also shouldn't pollute the session with a lot of object, since mostly we will deal with a lot of maintenance schedules from the same org.
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText: Same here.
timeline.author: hustodemon

timeline.bodyText: Now I remember our discussion about optional attributes on hibernate entities. If you want to use getCalendar, that return optional, you can move the annotations from the getter to the calendar field. But that's a subtle detail, feel free to keep it this way!
timeline.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText: That had other downsides if I remember. The behavior of hibernate is different when you assign it to getter or to fields. I better keep it like it is
replies.author: mcalmer

timeline.bodyText: These values will be used also by existing code (SCC client, for instance). Are 5 seconds reasonable for it?
timeline.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText:
I think yes. Socket timeout means, 5 seconds without data going over the line.
But I think about changing the default to 10 seconds as this was a timeout used by salt-api for example.
replies.author: mcalmer

Revert calling saveMessages unconditionally

We want `saveMessages` to only be called if an error occurred.

success.
In particular this causes messages like: "OS Image Build Host type has
been applied." to not be displayed when updating `System Properties`.
